meanings.definition: Required by a legal, moral, or other obligation; compulsory.
meanings.sent1: Wearing a helmet is obligatorily when riding a bike.
meanings.sent2: It is obligatorily to follow the rules of the game.
meanings.sent3: The obligatorily seatbelt made the teddy bear look funny in the car.
meanings.sent4: The obligatorily safety net protected the acrobat from falling.
meanings.sent5: The obligatorily school uniform made all students look the same.

meanings.definition: In a manner that imposes an obligation.
meanings.sent1: She completed the task obligatorily before the deadline.
meanings.sent2: The contract obligatorily required his signature.
meanings.sent3: He obligatorily promised to bring a unicorn to the party.
meanings.sent4: The storm clouds obligatorily covered the sky before the rain.
meanings.sent5: The teacher obligatorily reminded the students to study for the test.
